oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard of soldiers hiking at Camp Gordon sent by Pvt. Joseph W. Knox to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox of Dyer, Tennessee, sent this postcard to his mother while en route from Camp Gordon, Ga. to Camp Merritt, N. J. He was tired of riding though every possible was done for their comfort. The Red Cross met them at every stop to give them something, and a Y.M.C.A. man gave them paper for letters. Knox served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. He arrived in France in September, 1918, and saw action during the final week of the Meuse-Argonne offensive. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
